arts.ttl: 'Credit to them' - Hull City boss highlights Blackburn Rovers strength
arts.sum: The verdict from the Hull City camp following their narrow defeat against Rovers

arts.ttl: Andy Dawson reveals his big Ruben Selles hope after Hull City's loss to Blackburn Rovers
arts.sum: Andy Dawson hopes the arrival of new boss Ruben Selles will be the kick-start to Hull City's season, after his two-game caretaker spell came to a frustrating end with a 1-0 home defeat to Blackburn Rovers . Dawson had previously spoken about lady luck not shining on City this season, and it was apparent again as Rovers went 80 minutes without having a shot at goal, despite leading 1-0.

arts.ttl: Blackburn Rovers answer 'character' question as John Eustace reacts to Hull win
arts.sum: Blackburn Rovers beat Hull City 1-0 at the MKM Stadium

arts.ttl: Ruben Selles watches on as Hull slump to the bottom after loss to Blackburn
arts.sum: The Tigers are now without a win in 11 games.

arts.ttl: New Hull City boss Ruben Selles watches Blackburn Rovers loss as size of task becomes clearer
arts.sum: In his final game in caretaker charge, Dawson made five changes to the side beaten at Boro last weekend, with Ryan Giles, Charlie Hughes, Gustavo Puerta, Ryan Longman and Chris Bedia coming into the side at the expense of Cody Drameh, Alfie Jones, Xavier Simons, Ryan Longman and Joao Pedro. Despite a promising start, City found themselves a goal down after 20 minutes when Rovers, who had barely ventured into opposition territory before that point, saw Callum Britain inside the box and his ball across goal cannoned off Sean McLoughlin's thigh and into the back of the Tigers net.

arts.ttl: Blackburn Rovers weather the storm and shut out Hull City to secure 1-0 win
arts.sum: John Eustace's side have won four games in a row and three in a row by a score of 1-0

arts.ttl: Blackburn Rovers player ratings as defence stands firm in Hull City win
arts.sum: Marks out of ten for John Eustace's side after beating Hull City

arts.ttl: Hull City player ratings as Puerta, Kamara and Bedia struggle in Blackburn Rovers defeat
arts.sum: Despite a dominant first half, City were a goal down at the break courtesy of a Sean McLoughlin own goal after 20 minutes when he inadvertently diverted a Callum Brittain cross into the back of his own net, which was harsh on the hosts, who had played well and created some good chances. Ryan Longman: Had City's first effort and then another which the goalkeeper spoiled, always willing to get on the ball even if he couldn't make something happen.

arts.ttl: Inside Acun Ilicali's decision to appoint Ruben Selles as new Hull City boss
arts.sum: Losing Selles and two members of his backroom staff has come like a dagger through their hearts at a time when their team are in the League One play-offs and going well, despite points deductions, fines, transfer embargoes, and God knows what else. Now the new head coach of Hull City, there will be those who question why Selles made it to the top of Acun Ilicali's most-wanted list after he made what was, in his own mind, a tough decision to part ways with Tim Walter.

arts.ttl: Predicted Hull City team for Blackburn Rovers with Charlie Hughes and Mason Burstow calls made
arts.sum: Hughes will be back for the visit of Rovers on Saturday, while Mason Burstow's first goal for the Tigers at the Riverside Stadium will have him pushing for a start. City's predicted starting XI: Pandur, Giles, Hughes, Jones, Coyle (c), Simons, Slater, Longman, Palmer, Kamara, Burstow.
